title: Make a claim about appropriate model of light

content.question: When monochromatic light is incident on the surface of a metal, there is a minimum frequency above which electrons are ejected from the metal, regardless of the intensity of the light. Which of the following claims is correct about which model of light best supports this observation?

choices.label: The wave model, because electrons also have wave properties.
The wave model, because frequency is a property of waves, not particles.
The particle model, because each photon has an energy proportional to its frequency.
The particle model, because electrons are particles and can interact only with other particles.

content.answer: The particle model, because each photon has an energy proportional to its frequency.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
